Verse: Be courageous, and let’s be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. May the Lord do that which seems good to him.
Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually.
Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the Lord’s work, because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.
Watch! Stand firm in the faith! Be courageous! Be strong!
You have an anointing from the Holy One, and you all have knowledge.
As for you, the anointing which you received from him remains in you.
Not rendering evil for evil or insult for insult; but instead blessing, knowing that you were called to this, that you may inherit a blessing.
Casting all your worries on him, because he cares for you.
Therefore exhort one another, and build each other up, even as you also do.
Be at peace among yourselves.
But you be strong! Don’t let your hands be slack, for your work will be rewarded.

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort, who comforts us in all our affliction, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction, through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us, even so our comfort also abounds through Christ.
But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.
But whenever someone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.
Therefore we don’t faint, but though our outward person is decaying, yet our inward person is renewed day by day.
For we walk by faith, not by sight.
He also brought me out into a large place. He delivered me, because he delighted in me.
He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.
But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you and guard you from the evil one.
You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me.
How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good.
You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses.
Put on therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance.
He said, “Greatly beloved man, don’t be afraid. Peace be to you. Be strong. Yes, be strong.” When he spoke to me, I was strengthened, and said, “Let my lord speak, for you have strengthened me.”
God himself is who goes before you. He will be with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you. Don’t be afraid. Don’t be discouraged.
For Yahweh your God is a merciful God. He will not fail you nor destroy you.
For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven.
He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in their hearts, yet so that man can’t find out the work that God has done from the beginning even to the end.
He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.
For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father.
And that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind.
Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but only what is good for building others up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear.
Being eager to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
And be kind to one another, tender hearted, forgiving each other, just as God also in Christ forgave you.
Walk in love, even as Christ also loved us and gave himself up for us.
Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might.
God will fight for you, and you shall be still.
The Lord is my strength and song. He has become my salvation.
He said, “I will make all my goodness pass before you, and will proclaim Yahweh’s name before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.”
I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within them. I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them a heart of flesh.
For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faith, gentleness, and self-control.
Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ
Let’s not be weary in doing good, for we will reap in due season if we don’t give up.
Let’s consider how to provoke one another to love and good works.
Let brotherly love continue.
Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.”
So that with good courage we say,“The Lord is my helper. I will not fear. What can man do to me?”
Let’s therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and may find grace for help in time of need.
Therefore with joy you will draw water out of the wells of salvation.
Therefore Yahweh will wait, that he may be gracious to you; and therefore he will be exalted, that he may have mercy on you, for Yahweh is a God of justice. Blessed are all those who wait for him.
Tell those who have a fearful heart, "Be strong! Don’t be afraid!"
Comfort, comfort my people,” says your God.
He gives power to the weak. He increases the strength of him who has no might.
Don’t you be afraid, for I am with you. Don’t be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you. Yes, I will help you. Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand of my righteousness.
For I, Yahweh your God, will hold your right hand, saying to you, ‘Don’t be afraid. I will help you.’
I will open rivers on the bare heights, and springs in the middle of the valleys.
Don’t be afraid, for I have redeemed you. I have called you by your name. You are mine.
When you pass through the waters, I will be with you, and through the rivers, they will not overflow you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned, and flame will not scorch you.
For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground.
Even to old age I am he, and even to gray hairs I will carry you. I have made, and I will bear. Yes, I will carry, and will deliver.
They shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun strike them, for he who has mercy on them will lead them. He will guide them by springs of water.
Sing, heavens, and be joyful, earth! Break out into singing, mountains! For Yahweh has comforted his people, and will have compassion on his afflicted.
For the Lord Yahweh will help me. Therefore I have not been confounded.
I, even I, am he who comforts you. Who are you, that you are afraid of man who shall die, and of the son of man who will be made as grass?
For the mountains may depart, and the hills be removed, but my loving kindness will not depart from you, and my covenant of peace will not be removed,” says Yahweh who has mercy on you.
Hey! Come, everyone who thirsts, to the waters!
And if you pour out your soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul, then your light will rise in darkness.

The Lord Yahweh’s Spirit is on me, because Yahweh has anointed me to preach good news to the humble. He has sent me to bind up the broken hearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives and release to those who are bound.
The oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness.
As one whom his mother comforts, so I will comfort you.
Behold, we call them blessed who endured. You have heard of the perseverance of Job and have seen the Lord in the outcome, and how the Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them. They will no longer be afraid or dismayed, neither will any be lacking.
I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I’m known by my own.
I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.
Jesus wept.
A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.
Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, I give to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.
This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.
That they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us;
I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one, that the world may know that you sent me and loved them, even as you loved me.
Then he said to Thomas, “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don’t be unbelieving, but believing.”
You must be born anew.
If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!
Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid. Don’t be dismayed, for Yahweh your God is with you wherever you go.
God is Peace.
It is because of Yahweh’s loving kindnesses that we are not consumed, because his mercies don’t fail.
They are new every morning. Great is your faithfulness.
For though he causes grief, yet he will have compassion according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.
Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and sanctified them.
The angel said to her, "Don’t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God."
My soul magnifies the Lord. My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.
For he who is mighty has done great things for me. Holy is his name.
He has filled the hungry with good things. He has sent the rich away empty.
Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.
Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.
When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her and said to her, “Don’t cry.”
For I, the Lord, don’t change.
Don’t be afraid, only believe.
I believe. Help my unbelief!
Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.
Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.
You of little faith, why did you doubt?
Jesus stood still and called them, and asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
Even so, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.
Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.
Therefore, whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.
He took our infirmities and bore our diseases.
But you go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
My child, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.
Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.
The Lord is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those who take refuge in him.
Don’t be grieved, for the joy of the Lord is your strength.
The Lord lift up his face toward you, and give you peace.
I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
Let your gentleness be known to all men. The Lord is at hand.
Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is with people who take advice.
God’s name is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.
That he may guard the paths of justice, and preserve the way of his saints.
Don’t let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.
Know that Yahweh, he is God. It is he who has made us, and we are his. We are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
Praise Yahweh, my soul! All that is within me, praise his holy name!
He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor repaid us for our iniquities.
Like a father has compassion on his children, so God has compassion on those who fear him.
Praise the Lord, my soul, and don’t forget all his benefits.
He covers himself with light as with a garment. He stretches out the heavens like a curtain.
In God, I take refuge.
He will not be afraid of evil news. His heart is steadfast, trusting in God.
Yahweh is gracious and righteous. Yes, our God is merciful.
The lord is my strength and song. He has become my salvation.
Out of my distress, I called on God. God answered me with freedom.
Great are your tender mercies, my Lord. Revive me according to your ordinances.
This is my comfort in my affliction, for your word has revived me.
Please let your loving kindness be for my comfort, according to your word to your servant.
Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live.
In my distress, I cried to Yahweh. He answered me.
I will lift up my eyes to the hills. Where does my help come from? My help comes from God.
But I trust in your loving kindness. My heart rejoices in your salvation. I will sing to Yahweh, because he has been good to me.
I wait for Yahweh. My soul waits. I hope in his word.
See how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together in unity!
The Lord will fulfill that which concerns me. Your loving kindness, Lord, endures forever. Don’t forsake the works of your own hands.
I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made.
The Lord upholds all who fall, and raises up all those who are bowed down.
The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and gracious in all his works.
The Lord is good to all. His tender mercies are over all his works.
He heals the broken in heart, and binds up their wounds.
He counts the number of the stars. He calls them all by their names.
Preserve me, God, for I take refuge in you.
He sent from on high. He took me. He drew me out of many waters.
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall lack nothing.
He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters.
He restores my soul. He guides me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me.
You prepare a table before mein the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil. My cup runs over.
To you, my Lord, I lift up my soul.
God is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? God is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?
When my father and my mother forsake me, then Yahweh will take me up.
Wait for Yahweh. Be strong, and let your heart take courage.
Blessed be the Lord, because he has heard the voice of my petitions.
God is my strength and my shield. My heart has trusted in him, and I am helped.
The Lord will give strength to his people. The Lord will bless his people with peace.
I will not be afraid of tens of thousands of people who have set themselves against me on every side.
In you, my Lord, I take refuge. Let me never be disappointed. Deliver me in your righteousness.
But I trust in you, Lord. I said, “You are my God.” My times are in your hand. Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.
Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who hope in Yahweh.
You are my hiding place. You will preserve me from trouble. You will surround me with songs of deliverance.
Our soul has waited for God. He is our help and our shield.
For our heart rejoices in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger, but those who seek the Lord shall not lack any good thing.
The Lord is near to those who have a broken heart, and saves those who have a crushed spirit.
I sought God, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.
For with you is the spring of life. In your light we will see light.
A man’s steps are established by the Lord. He delights in his way.
Though he stumble, he shall not fall, for Yahweh holds him up with his hand.
For I hope in you, Yahweh. You will answer, Lord my God.
Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in you.
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay. He set my feet on a rock, and gave me a firm place to stand.
You have loved righteousness, and hated wickedness. Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.
Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity. Cleanse me from my sin.
I trust in God’s loving kindness forever and ever.
Cast your burden on Yahweh and he will sustain you.
You count my wanderings. You put my tears into your container.
Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me, for my soul takes refuge in you.
I cry out to God Most High, to God who accomplishes my requests for me.
My soul, wait in silence for God alone, for my expectation is from him.
He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress. I will not be shaken.
The river of God is full of water.
In you, my Lord, I take refuge. Never let me be disappointed.
My flesh and my heart fails, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
You are the God who does wonders. You have made your strength known among the peoples.
Preserve my soul, for I am godly. You, my God, save your servant who trusts in you.
The Lord says, 'I will rescue those who love me. I will protect those who trust in my name.'
They will still produce fruit in old age. They will be full of sap and green.
When I said, “My foot is slipping!” Your loving kindness, my Lord, held me up.
In the multitude of my thoughts within me, your comforts delight my soul.
Oh come, let’s worship and bow down. Let’s kneel before Yahweh, our Maker, for he is our God. We are the people of his pasture, and the sheep in his care.
Don’t be afraid. I am the first and the last, 18 and the Living one. I was dead, and behold, I am alive forever and ever. Amen.
He will wipe away every tear from their eyes. Death will be no more; neither will there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain any more. The first things have passed away.
I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give freely to him who is thirsty from the spring of the water of life.
For the Lamb who is in the middle of the throne shepherds them and leads them to springs of life-giving waters. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.
Rejoice with those who rejoice. Weep with those who weep.
If it is possible, as much as it is up to you, be at peace with all men.
So we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another.
Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor that which is evil. Cling to that which is good.
Love doesn’t harm a neighbor. Love therefore is the fulfillment of the law.
So then, let’s follow after things which make for peace, and things by which we may build one another up.
Let each one of us please his neighbor for that which is good, to be building him up.
Now the God of perseverance and of encouragement grant you to be of the same mind with one another according to Christ Jesus.
For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.
